newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia foreign student income surges.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia foreign student income surges.

text.p: Australian Employment Minister Amanda Vanstone said on Wednesday the number of foreigners wanting to study in Australia had surged, despite the recent damaging race debate.
Student visa applications from October to January, 1997, were 11 percent higher than the same period a year earlier.
Total spending by foreign students in Australia jumped 21 percent to A$2.8 billion in fiscal 1995/96 from A$2.3 billion in the year to June 30, 1995.
Australia was wracked by a damaging race debate after independent parliamentarian Pauline Hanson warned in a September speech the country was being swamped by Asian immigrants.
The row sparked allegations of an increase in abuse against Asians in Australia and reports some foreign students were being victimised.
"These figures indicate that our neighbours give no credibility to the so-called Hanson racism debate, a treatment which it fully deserves," Vanstone said in a statement.
"International students are making a strong contribution to improving Australia's trade balance and play a very important role in the Australian economy," she said.
A study by the Bureau of Immigration, Multicultural and Population Research found last year that about 86 percent of Australia's 70,000 foreign students came from Asia.
